items.title: US Manufacturers Make Big Plans in 2025
Research Project Aims to Expand Aluminum in Auto Industry
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- A five-year collaboration between the University of Michigan and Norsk Hydro aims to advance **aluminum recycling** in the auto industry through the Center for Recycling, Extrusion and Aluminum Technology (**CREATe**).
- Three teams will tackle *iron impurities* via: **chemical alloying** to alter impurity shape, **electrical treatment** during solidification to reduce their effects, and **computational design** to tolerate higher recycled content.
- **Hydro** and Michigan's push toward a Midwest circular economy are supported by a $150M recycling plant and dedicated R&D facilities focusing on recycling and extrusion.

items.title: New Initiative Focuses on Robot Communication
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- The VDMA OPC Robotics Initiative released version 1.02 of the OPC Robotics Companion Specification, enabling *OPC UA*-based high‑level control and cross‑vendor robot communication.
- It adds vendor‑independent asset management, condition monitoring and remote operation, unifying data across current and future robots and cloud apps.
- Leaders say OPC UA lets robots share a common language with the automation world, advancing *Industry 4.0* from shop floor to cloud.

items.title: NIST Report Calls for Sustainable Metals Infrastructure
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- The NIST report urges a more *efficient*, *sustainable*, and *resilient* metals infrastructure across life cycles—from mining to recycling—to boost U.S. innovation and security.
- It highlights adopting new extraction methods, data tools, and alloy design, with emphasis on *critical materials* like lithium and cobalt to strengthen supply chains.
- It also calls for stronger standards and new certification programs to improve metals reuse, enable greater recycling, and expand markets for recycled content.

items.title: New Tool Controller Increases Flexibility, Improves Maintenance
Airbus Faces A Pair of A320 Quality Issues Over the Course of a Few Days
items.summary:
- **Airbus** confirmed a new industrial quality issue affecting metal fuselage panels on a limited number of **A320**-family aircraft, impacting roughly 50 jets in *production*. 
- The issue has been *identified*, contained, and resolved for all newly manufactured panels; there is no evidence affected parts have reached in‑service aircraft. 
- The report follows a rapid **software recall** and could influence **delivery** timing, though only a portion of affected aircraft will require further action.

items.title: Cobots May Enable Autistic Adults to Thrive in Manufacturing
Epson Robot Wins New Product of the Year
items.summary:
- The *GX-C Series* SCARA robot from Epson was named **New Product of the Year** in The Assembly Show's Robotics category, praised for boosting *efficiency*, *precision*, and lowering *costs*. 
- The episode covers the show recap, flexible feeding, a soldering-automation robot, and a preview of the Manufacturing and Automation Exchange in March. 
- Tune in on the first Tuesday of each month for the latest episode of **ASSEMBLY News Now**.

Workers Believe Robots Are More a Help Than a Hindrance
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary: - *Unimate* pioneered robotics at GM; attitudes shifted from suspicion to broad acceptance worldwide.\n- The Messe Munchen survey across five countries finds robots are viewed as boosting productivity and competitiveness, not stealing jobs.\n- In the U.S., most workers see robots reducing injuries and aiding skilled labor, though acceptance varies by country.

items.title: Boeing Strike Ends as Union Approves New Contract
items.summary:
- After a **three-month** strike, about 3,200 IAMAW members voted **68%** in favor of a new five-year contract at Boeing Defense in St. Louis.
- The pact includes a **$6,000 signing bonus** (up from $5,000) and a **24% general wage increase** (8% first year, then 4% annually), but omits a **$10,000 ratification bonus** and 401(k) match.
- The agreement aims to restore stability with all members returning to work, while unions push for improved benefits in future negotiations amid concerns about military readiness.

items.title: Suppliers Navigate Lidar Assembly Challenges
Stellantis to Build Midsize Truck at Illinois Plant
items.summary:
- *Stellantis* plans to reopen the Belvidere plant in 2027 to build a new *midsize truck*, signaling a strategic shift.
- The company has canceled plans for a fully electric Ram pickup and Jeep Gladiator 4xe, leaving the truck's powertrain undecided (**electric** vs *gas*).
- About 960 workers are on recall as the plant eyes a 2027 launch after a DOE electrification grant, with electrification funding at issue.

items.title: Humanoid Robots Complete Trial Project at BMW Assembly Plant
items.summary:
- Two *Figure AI* *Figure 02* humanoids completed an 11‑month pilot at BMW's Spartanburg body shop, logging 1,250 hours and handling 90,000+ parts toward more than 30,000 BMW X3 vehicles. 
- The robots performed a classic *pick-and-place* task, chasing cycle targets (37 s load, 84 s per task) with 99% per‑shift accuracy, while forearm and *wrist electronics* redesigns improved reliability and thermal management. 
- Insights from the run informed the upcoming *Figure 03* design, highlighting reliability, rapid adaptation, and reduced hardware failures for future automotive automation.

items.title: Rockwell Automation to Build Assembly Plant in Wisconsin
items.summary:
- Rockwell Automation will build a new greenfield site in southeastern Wisconsin as part of a **$2B** investment in plants, digital infrastructure and talent.
- The facility, over 1 million sq ft, will feature *advanced automation*, robotics, AI and analytics to boost efficiency and training.
- The project aims to grow Rockwell’s U.S. manufacturing footprint and could become the company’s largest global campus.

items.title: First Solar Opens $1.1B AI Plant in Louisiana
items.summary:
- First Solar opened a $1.1B, *2.4-million-square-foot* plant in *Iberia Parish, LA*, employing 700+ workers (826 by year‑end) with a *3.5 GW/yr* output.
- The facility uses AI for defect detection and process tuning, sourcing *American-made materials* (glass from Illinois and Ohio; steel in Mississippi; rails in Louisiana) to meet FEOC guidance.
- It anchors a large Western Hemisphere solar‑tech footprint with sister plants in Ohio and Alabama, plus R&D in OH/CA, and a parallel *$330M* onshore line for Series 6 production in Gaffney, SC.

items.title: The Connected Worker Manufacturing Stack
GM Wins 4 R&D 100 Awards for Breakthrough Tech
items.summary:
- GM earns four **R&D 100 Awards** recognizing breakthroughs in *digital manufacturing*, *battery science*, *propulsion efficiency*, and *next-generation materials*.
- **DR-Weld High-Performance Digital Reality Simulation Tool** co-developed with Oak Ridge National Laboratory, delivering results thousands of times faster and reducing development from months to days.
- Other awarded technologies include the **Extreme Fast-Charging, Affordable EV Battery Cell Architecture**, the **Ultra-Robust Silicon All-Solid-State Battery**, and a **Low-Mass, High-Efficiency Medium-Duty Truck Engine** prototype.

items.title: GM Invests $250 Million in Parma Metal Center in Ohio
items.summary:
- *GM's* $250M Parma Metal Center expansion in Ohio will boost stamping and assemblies for vehicles tied to GM plants, strengthening North American production.
- The investment is part of GM's $5.5B 2025 manufacturing push to expand domestic capacity and reinforce supply chains for **ICE** and **EV** models.
- *GM* is also funding workforce development—training, *STEM/STEAM* initiatives, and apprenticeships—to prepare workers for advanced manufacturing with new technologies.

items.title: Chrysler Thrived, But Also Struggled to Survive
Digit Moves 100K Totes at Distribution Center
items.summary:
- Digit, a *humanoid robot*, has moved over 100,000 totes at GXO’s Flowery Branch facility, proving it can operate in existing facilities without major infrastructure changes and handle varied tasks in the same workflow.
- Agility uses a practical AI pipeline—combining traditional control, teleoperation, reinforcement learning, and simulation—to enable *dynamic balancing* and *vision-driven grasping* that adapt to changing environments and real-world workflows.
- **Safety** and **trust** are prioritized as Digit stays in long-term production settings, building a model for safe human–robot collaboration and enabling scalable adoption of humanoid automation.

Emirates & Safran to Build Dubai Seat Plant
items.summary:
- Emirates and **Safran Seats** sign an MoU to build a new aircraft seat facility in **Dubai**, initially for *Business and Economy Class* retrofit seats with plans to expand to line-fit production.
- The site will boost regional capacity, streamline supply chains for **Emirates** and other **Safran** customers, and use advanced automation to meet rising global seating demand.
- Spanning 20,000–25,000 m², the plant aims to assemble up to 1,000 **Business Class** seats per year at ramp-up, with completion targeted for Q4 2027.
